Chop Suey

Chop suey is a classic Chinese-American dish that typically consists of meat (chicken, pork, or beef), vegetables, and a savory sauce, all served over rice or noodles. Here's a recipe for chicken chop suey that you can try at home:

Ingredients

  • 1/2 lb chicken breast or tofu, sliced into bite-sized pieces
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 cup carrots, sliced diagonally
  • 1 cup green beans, cut into 2-inch pieces
  • 1 cup cabbage, sliced
  • 1 red bell pepper, sliced
  • 1 green bell pepper, sliced
  • 1 cup chicken or vegetable broth
  • 1 tbsp cornstarch
  • 2 tbsp soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp vegetable oil
  • Salt and pepper, to taste

    • Procedures

  • In a large wok or pan, heat the vegetable oil over high heat.
  • Sauté the chicken or tofu until browned and cooked through.
  • Add the onions and garlic, and sauté until fragrant and the onions are translucent.
  • Add the carrots, green beans, cabbage, and bell peppers, and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
  • In a small bowl, whisk together the chicken or vegetable broth, cornstarch, and soy sauce
  • Pour the sauce over the vegetables and chicken/tofu, and stir until the sauce thickens and coats the vegetables.
  • Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  • Serve hot with steamed rice.

    • Try this other recipes!
